intro: Dinacrusa hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy dinacrusa, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Dinacrusa hirsuta is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in regions with low rainfall.
